feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 4:20AM AKST until February 11 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST FRIDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COASTLINE... * WHAT...Blowing snow occurring. North-northeast winds of 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph combined with snow will reduce visibilities to one half mile. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 4:11AM AKST until February 12 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 50 below zero.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The Northeast Gulf Coast including Yakutat. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Friday.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Snow showers will move back into the Lake Superior snowbelt region during the day, and could result in another couple inches of snow in that area.
